turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Oil production and smuggling in ISIL.
turn.1: What was the main oil smuggling routes?
turn.2: Arab media accused Israel of being a major buyer of oil smuggled out of the ISIL-held Syrian and Iraqi territories.
turn.3: Why was this oil sold to Israel?
turn.4: According to this accusation, oil was smuggled to Zakhu where Israeli and Turkish dealers would determine the price, the oil was then sent as Kurdish oil to Silopi, Turkey, and transported to Turkish ports (such as Ceyhan) and shipped to Israel.
turn.5: What other routes were used to transport the oil?
turn.6: ISIL transferred oil in different ways out of its territory.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Oil could be trucked to Turkey, refined there and be used in Turkey or transported to tankers at the ports of Ceyhan or Dortyol.
turn.9: Who was the main consumer of the oil?
turn.10: Oil could also be sold to middlemen in northern Iraq who then would mix it with legitimate oil that enter through one of many feeders the Kirkuk-Ceyhan pipeline.
turn.11: Was there any punishments for the people who discovered the smuggling routes?
turn.12: At the end of the pipeline it would have been difficult to determine if some ISIS oil was present in the mix that was supposed to come from Kurdish fields.
